title: Why BF3 is nonpolar and NF3 is polar

content.question:
The BF3 molecule is nonpolar, whereas the NF3
 molecule is polar. Which of the following
 statements accounts for the difference in polarity
 of the two molecules?

choices.label:
In NF3, each F is joined to N with multiple
 bonds, whereas in BF3 , each F is joined to
 B with single bonds.

N — F bonds are polar, whereas B — F bonds
 are nonpolar.

NF3 is an ionic compound, whereas BF3 is a
 molecular compound.

Unlike BF3, NF3 has a nonplanar geometry
 due to an unshared pair of electrons on the
 N atom.

content.answer:
Unlike BF3, NF3 has a nonplanar geometry
 due to an unshared pair of electrons on the
 N atom.
